data.title: Thoma Bravo Team
data.meta_description: Thoma Bravo is a leading Private Equity firm with expertise in technology and software across cybersecurity, infrastructure, and IT applications.
data.text:
Seth Boro is a Managing Partner at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, he joined the firm in 2005, then became a Partner in 2010 and a Managing Partner in 2013. Seth leads the firm’s infrastructure software and cybersecurity strategy, and he is responsible for finding and executing new deals, growing portfolio companies as an active board member, and helping to manage the firm. He previously was part of the investment team at Summit Partners, where he was involved in private equity investments in the technology and business services sectors. Seth also worked as an analyst with investment bank Credit Suisse in Toronto. He has been featured in Mergers & Acquisitions Magazine as one of the “Rising Stars” of private equity and was named by the San Francisco Business Times as one of the region’s “40 Under 40” for his business leadership contributions in building the Bay Area’s future. Additionally, Seth is a co-founder and on the board of the Room to Breathe Project, which is committed to supporting youth and mental health in under-resourced communities by developing the social and emotional well-being of young people and the adults who support them. Seth is also on the board of the NHL’s Ottawa Senators. Seth earned his MBA from Stanford University and his Bachelor of Commerce degree from Queen’s University School of Business in Canada.

Scott Crabill is a Managing Partner at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, he joined the firm in 2002 to help develop its investment strategy in the software industry. Scott is responsible for identifying and executing new deals, working closely with portfolio companies as an active board member, and helping to manage the firm. He was previously part of the investment team at Summit Partners, where he was involved in private equity investments in software and other technology businesses. Scott also worked as an investment professional at private equity firm J.H. Whitney and in corporate finance at Alex. Brown & Sons. Additionally, he is a board member of the CPMC Foundation, which is the capital raising arm of Sutter Health hospital in San Francisco. Scott earned a BS degree in Industrial Engineering from Stanford University and an MBA degree from the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Carl D. Thoma is a Founder and Managing Partner at Thoma Bravo. He was a Co-Founder and Managing Director at Golder, Thoma, Cressey, Rauner and its predecessor funds since 1980. He began his career at First Chicago Equity Group where he helped build one of the largest and most active private equity firms in the country. He is a recognized pioneer of the buy-and-build strategy that is the foundation of Thoma Bravo's strategy today.

Carl is an avid art collector, which he parallels to the process of acquiring, partnering with, and refining a company. Carl received an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business and a BS degree in Accounting and Agriculture Economics from Oklahoma State University.

He is currently on the boards of the McKnight Center for the Performing Arts, SITE Santa Fe, the Terra Foundation for American Art, and is a commissioner for the National Portrait Gallery. Together with his wife Marilynn, Carl runs the Carl & Marilynn Thoma Art Foundation, a grant-making organization dedicated to sharing its collection and supporting museums, projects and individuals pursuing innovative ideas in the visual arts: www.thomafoundation.org.

Jennifer James is Managing Director, Chief Operating Officer and Head of Investor Relations & Marketing at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, she joined the firm in 2015 with 20 years of experience in private equity/venture capital investor relations, fundraising, and marketing. Today she leads Thoma Bravo's business operations strategy, efforts to serve the needs of new and existing investors, and the firm's industry communications programs. Wall Street Journal and WSJ PRO Private Equity named Jennifer one of the Women to Watch in fundraising, and San Francisco Business Times honored her as one of the Most Influential Women in the Bay Area. Before Thoma Bravo, she served as Partner, Investor Relations & Marketing, for Sofinnova Ventures. Previously, she served as Director of Marketing & Communications for Alta Partners, and she held several marketing and financial services leadership roles. Jennifer earned her MBA from Northwestern University and her AB degree in History from Bowdoin College.

Gerald T. "Jerry" Nowak is Managing Director, Chief Administrative and Legal Officer at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2021 and is responsible for Thoma Bravo's Legal & Compliance, IT and other administrative functions. Previously, Jerry served as a Partner in Kirkland & Ellis LLP's Chicago office, where he was a leader in the firm's Private Equity, M&A and Capital Markets practices, working closely with Thoma Bravo for almost 20 years on a variety of transactions and mandates. Jerry has been the principal attorney on hundreds of private equity, M&A and capital markets over the years. He has been named as a top practitioner in the The International Who's Who of Mergers & Acquisition Lawyers, as a “Super lawyer” in Law & Politics Magazine's annual review, and as a top high yield debt practitioner in The Legal 500's yearly review of Corporate & Finance attorneys. Earlier in his career, Jerry served as a Military Officer and Computer Systems Cost Analyst with the United States Air Force. He earned a JD from the University of Michigan Law School, an MBA from Auburn University, and a BA in Economic Policy Analysis from Michigan State University.

Amy Coleman Redenbaugh is a Managing Director and Thoma Bravo's Chief Financial Officer. Based in Chicago, she joined the firm in 2008 and is responsible for all finance/accounting, tax, portfolio valuation, and financial reporting. Private Funds CFO named her to its inaugural list of Changemakers who helped shape the CFO role within private equity. Before joining Thoma Bravo, Amy was the Chief Financial Officer of Quinten Road Management, an asset manager formed by GE Antares and Northwestern Mutual to provide junior capital supporting sponsor-led middle-market leveraged buyouts. Earlier in her career, she was a Tax Manager in the Private Client Services Group at Arthur Andersen. Amy received a BS in Business Administration and Accounting from Indiana University of Pennsylvania.

Tony Akers is Chief Information Security Officer at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2022 to manage internal cybersecurity initiatives. Before Thoma Bravo, Tony was a Security Architect at Ardagh Group focused on global cybersecurity and cloud applications. Previously he spent 10 years with Rexam PLC in various leadership roles focused on enterprise IT infrastructure. Additionally, Tony was an Exchange Support Engineer II at Microsoft and a Systems Engineer at Wachovia. Before his career in IT, he spent four years with the U.S. Navy based in Yokosuka, Japan. Tony is an author with Practical365.com and holds several Microsoft, cybersecurity, and cloud IT certifications.

Stephanie Barrios is an Administrative Assistant with Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, she joined the firm in 2023. Before Thoma Bravo, Stephanie was Marketing Coordinator at ORA Acupuncture in New York, leading comprehensive marketing campaigns and events to establish and increase brand awareness. Before ORA Acupuncture, she worked as an Executive Assistant at Miami Dolphins, supporting the Chief Financial Officer, General Counsel, and Senior Vice President of Human Resources. During that time, Stephanie also managed expense and budget reports for multiple departments, monitored expenditures for major events like the Miami Open, and acted as a White Glove liaison for ownership during Super Bowl LIV. Previously, she was a Sales Associate for Michael Kors and an Executive Assistant for the Law Office of Georgette Sosa Douglass. Stephanie holds a BS in Communication and Media Studies from Nova Southeastern University.

Donna Riley Bebb is Head of ESG at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, she joined the firm in 2022 to lead Thoma Bravo's enterprise-wide ESG strategy and build upon the firm's long-standing commitment to environmental, social and governance efforts. Before Thoma Bravo, Donna was Head of Global Credit and ESG at Google for nearly five years. In that role, she oversaw $56 billion of corporate cash and designed an investment-grade ESG portfolio strategy to lower risks and enhance returns in alignment with Google's mission and values. Before Google, Donna spent three years as a Research Fellow focused on ESG innovation for the Steyer-Taylor Center for Energy Policy and Finance at Stanford University. She spent the beginning of her career at various corporate and investment firms in credit and financial roles. Donna earned an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University, and she graduated summa cum laude from Temple University with a BBA in Risk Management.

Sami Blum is an Investor Relations Associate at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, she joined the firm in 2023. Before Thoma Bravo, Sami worked for White Wolf Capital as an Investment Analyst for the firm’s Private Funds strategy, where she invested in private fund managers as a limited partner after her role as an Associate on the firm’s Portfolio Management team supporting the firm’s private equity and private credit strategies. Previously, she worked as an associate at EY providing advisory and assurance services to public and private clients in various industries. Sami graduated summa cum laude with a BSBA in Accounting from the University of Pittsburgh.

Justin Cueto is an Associate at Thoma Bravo. He joined the firm in 2023 to work directly with Founder and Managing Partner Carl Thoma on family office investments, strategic growth initiatives, and other special projects. Before Thoma Bravo, Justin was a Senior Associate at Ancor Capital Partners, evaluating new investment opportunities, executing transactions, and supporting portfolio company operations. Previously, he was an Investment Analyst at Bonanza Capital and an Investment Banking Analyst at Stephens Inc. Justin holds an MS in Accounting from the University of Virginia, and he graduated with honors from Centenary College of Louisiana with a BS in Accounting and Finance.

Alexis Czaja is Director of Human Resources at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, she joined the firm in 2021. Alexis brings 18 years of experience leading Human Resources departments and programs for multiple organizations across the financial industry. Most recently, she was Human Resources Director at Waud Capital Partners, a growth-focused mid-market private equity firm. There, she was responsible for all facets of human resources, including talent acquisition and retention, co-founding the diversity and inclusion committee, revamping company benefits, streamlining payroll processes, and onboarding new employees. Previously she was VP & HR Business Partner at Antares Capital, Assistant VP and Senior HR Business Partner at Mesirow Financial - Advanced Strategies, and Human Resources Manager at Aurora Investment Management. Alexis has her BBA in Marketing from Saint Xavier University.

Danielle (“Dani”) W. Dixon is a Counsel at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, she joined the firm in 2021. Before joining Thoma Bravo, Dani served as a Senior Associate at Croke Fairchild Morgan & Beres, where she focused on the formation, structuring and operation of various funds and their management companies. Prior to that, Dani was an Associate in the Kirkland & Ellis Investment Funds Group, representing sponsors across different private investment vehicles. Earlier she worked as an Associate in the Corporate Group of Greenberg Traurig. Dani is a graduate of University of Michigan Law School, and she holds a BA with distinction in Biopsychology Cognition and Neuroscience (BCN) and Political Science from the University of Michigan.

Natalie Doak is Treasury Manager at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, she rejoined the firm in 2021. Natalie worked as a consultant on the Thoma Bravo finance team before joining full-time to assist with treasury operations and onboarding new investors and new funds. Earlier, she worked as an Accounting Admin on the finance team at Thoma Bravo. Before Thoma Bravo, Natalie was a Customer Service Representative with Ecologic, LLC. She began her career in sports marketing and sales as an Account Executive for the Chicago Fire soccer team and with the University of Oregon student government, where she helped manage a $10 million budget and negotiated relationships between students and the athletic department. Natalie holds a BS in Business Administration from the University of Oregon.

Dariusz Dziurdzik is Vice President, Tax and Accounting at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2019. Dariusz is responsible for the firm's tax and financial reporting as it relates to funds and GP entities. Previously he worked for PwC, most recently as Senior Tax Manager. Before that, he was the Senior Tax Associate - Financial Services at Ernst & Young. Dariusz is a Certified Public Accountant, and he holds a Masters of Accountancy from the University of Notre Dame Mendoza College of Business and a BBA in Accounting and Finance from Loyola University Chicago.

Megan Frank is Managing Director, Head of Communications and Marketing at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, she joined the firm in 2019 and is responsible for defining and driving the firm’s communications strategy across audiences to protect, promote and enhance the Thoma Bravo brand. Megan has more than 20 years of experience in communications, most recently serving as the Head of Communications for Allianz Global Investors in the US. Prior to that, she held communications and media relations roles at Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley and Paine Webber (now UBS), as well as PR agencies including Burson-Marsteller. Megan earned a BA in Political Science from Colgate University.

Etham Frenkel is a Vice President on the Growth team at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, he joined the firm in 2022 and focuses on crypto/web3 and software investments. Before joining Thoma Bravo, Etham worked as an Associate at General Atlantic, where he invested in and partnered with growth-stage technology companies. Prior to General Atlantic, he worked as an Investment Banking Analyst at Goldman Sachs. Additionally, he has served in startup roles at Modern Treasury and FalconX. Etham holds an MBA from Harvard University and a BSE degree in Chemical & Biomolecular Engineering from Tulane University, where he graduated summa cum laude, Phi Beta Kappa and competed on the Men’s Tennis team.

Sylvia Griego is Chief of Staff, Office of Orlando Bravo at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, she joined the firm in 2021. Sylvia has more than 15 years of administrative management and operations experience in both the private and public sectors. In her most recent role, Sylvia worked as Executive Assistant and Manager of Office Administration for the President, COO & CFO at iHeartMedia. Before iHeartMedia, she was Executive Assistant to the CEO and COO at Corbin Capital Partners, and she served as Senior Executive Assistant to the SVP of Investor Relations and Chief Corporate Communications Officer at AECOM. Previously, Sylvia was Executive Assistant and Governmental Affairs Consultant for the Law Office of Harriet O’Neill & Cammack & Strong, and she worked as Chief of Staff for Justice Harriet O’Neill on the Supreme Court of Texas. Sylvia studied Public Relations at The University of Texas at Austin.

Christine Kang is a Principal on the Growth team at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, she joined the firm in 2021. Prior to Thoma Bravo, Christine worked as a Vice President at General Atlantic, helping lead growth equity investments across the technology industry. Previously, she served as an Associate at Thomas H. Lee Partners in Boston and began her career as an Analyst in the Investment Banking Division at J.P. Morgan in New York. Christine holds an MBA from Harvard University and a BA with Honors in Economics from Stanford University, where she received the J.E. Wallace Sterling Award for Scholastic Achievement.

Faizan Khan is Vice President, Service Desk at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, he joined the firm in 2021. Faizan has more than eight years of experience resolving technical issues across various IT areas and currently manages the IT service desk for Thoma Bravo. Before Thoma Bravo, Faizan served as an IT Support Engineer at Ascend Technologies and at West Monroe Partners, where he managed internal IT troubleshooting and resolution. Previously he worked as an Associate System Administrator for the Association for Talent Development and Junior System Administrator for Interstate Moving. Faizan holds a Master's degree in Information Technology from George Mason University and a BS in Information Technology from Air University.

Mark Maier is Director, Chief Technology Officer at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2021 to focus on user experience and productivity. Before Thoma Bravo, Mark held several roles at Donnelley Financial Solutions, most recently as a Director responsible for the management and operations of user productivity platforms. Previously he spent 12 years at Mesirow Financial, most recently as a Vice President responsible for the IT operations of Mesirow Advanced Strategies. He began his career in IT consulting with Deloitte and Catavo. Mark holds a BS in General Engineering from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

Lauren McLaughlin is the People Operations Manager for Thoma Bravo's Chicago office. She joined the firm in 2019. Lauren is responsible for Thoma Bravo's Chicago office project management and supports the firm's Human Resources and Compliance teams. Previously she served as the Institutional Sales Support Coordinator for Capital Group Institutional Investment Services, where she helped manage relationships across 200 clients representing more than $1 billion in new and existing client flows. Prior to Capital Group, Lauren was the Managing Co-Chair for Gala 4 Good, the largest fundraiser for the Hinsdale Junior Woman's Club. Before that, she held various project management, marketing, and executive assistant roles at Global Electronic Trading Company, Contego Capital Partners LLC, and Merrill Lynch. Lauren holds a BA in Communications Management and Marketing from the University of Dayton.

Matthew Negron is a Vice President of Investor Relations at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, he joined the firm in 2023. Prior to Thoma Bravo, Matt was a member of the Private Markets team within the Institutional Client Group at Apollo Global Management, where he was responsible for fundraising and investor relations for the firm’s flagship Private Equity and Infrastructure products. Earlier in his career, he was a member of the fundraising and investor relations team within the Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM) division at Goldman Sachs and the private capital advisory team of Stanwich Advisors LLC. Matt holds BA degrees in Economics and Hispanic Studies from Boston College.

Alex Park is a Principal on the Credit team at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, he joined the firm in 2019. Previously he worked at Ares Management in New York as a senior associate in the Credit group, where he underwrote and maintained credit facilities for corporate and sponsor-backed companies across a wide range of industries. He also assisted in strategic endeavors, including portfolio acquisitions and fundraising activities. Prior to Ares Management, he worked in the Restructuring group at Rothschild, where he advised debtors and creditors on a variety of restructuring and M&A transactions. Alex holds a BA in Economics and History from Columbia University.

Hudson Smith is a Partner at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, he joined the firm in 2016. Hudson is responsible for finding and executing new deals and monitoring and growing the portfolio as an active board member for the firm’s Discover funds, which focus on investing in mid-sized software and technology companies. Prior to joining Thoma Bravo, he served as Managing Director of HGGC, where he led software and technology investments. Previously, he worked at Bain & Company in Dallas and Sidney and Lincoln International in Chicago. Hudson earned an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University and a BS degree in Business Administration, magna cum laude, from Washington and Lee University.

Candice Sorbera is a Senior Vice President of Investor Relations at Thoma Bravo. Based in New York, she joined the firm in 2024 to focus on fundraising and investor relations initiatives. Before Thoma Bravo, Candice was Managing Director and Head of Investor Relations at Butterfly Equity, a private equity firm specializing in the food sector. Previously, she was a Principal on the Private Equity Institutional Client Solutions team at The Blackstone Group, where she was responsible for institutional fundraising and investor relations for the firm’s buyout, long-dated, opportunistic, secondaries, infrastructure, growth equity, and life sciences funds. She began her career at Goldman Sachs, in the Alternative Investments & Manager Selection group. Candice earned a BBA in Finance from Fordham University’s Gabelli School of Business, where she graduated Valedictorian.

Marcin Spik is Vice President, Tax and Accounting at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2023 to assist with tax compliance and accounting for the general partner entities. Before Thoma Bravo, Marcin was a Senior Tax Manager for the Investment Funds group at Plante Moran. Previously, he held several tax management roles for global accounting and professional services firms, including PwC and Crowe LLP. Marcin is a Certified Public Accountant. He has a Master of Accounting Science degree and graduated with highest honors with a BS in Accountancy and a BS in Finance from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

Kevin Stark is a Senior Infrastructure Engineer at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2022 to focus on supporting, improving, and automating the IT infrastructure. Before Thoma Bravo, Kevin was a Cloud/Infrastructure Professional Services Engineer at Ascend Technologies. While at Ascend, he served as the onsite engineer for Thoma Bravo. Previously he spent five years in the United States Marine Corps, working in various IT roles focused on quality assurance, disaster recovery, and aviation IT logistics. Kevin has a BSBA degree in Management Information Systems and New Venture Development from the University of Arizona. Additionally, he completed military occupation specialty (MOS) training at the Aviation Logistics Tactical Information Systems (ALTIS) School for the U.S. Marine Corps.

Liam Stewart is a Senior Valuation Associate at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2021. As part of the valuation team, Liam helps manage the firm's valuation needs, including quarterly valuations of its credit and equity investments. Previously he worked for Lincoln International's Valuations & Opinions Group, where he performed portfolio valuations and assisted Lincoln in rendering fairness and solvency opinions. Before that, he was an analyst in Stout's Corporate Valuation Advisory practice. Liam is a graduate of the University of Notre Dame, where he graduated cum laude with a BBA in Finance.

Jennifer Wade is Senior Vice President, Communications and Marketing at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, she joined the firm in 2021. In this role, Jennifer manages the firm’s content marketing, PR, and social strategy to elevate the Thoma Bravo brand and the firm’s portfolio companies. Before Thoma Bravo, she led marketing and communications at Comcast Ventures, where she managed content production and editorial strategy. While there, Jennifer worked with the company’s executives and portfolio companies to build brand awareness and generate deal flow. Previously Jennifer worked as a field reporter and producer for several NBC stations in California and Oregon. Before that, she served as a brand spokesperson and managed digital content and various social initiatives for Sony Pictures Entertainment. Jennifer graduated cum laude with a BBA in Marketing from Loyola Marymount University.

Cook Wylly is a Principal on the Growth team at Thoma Bravo. Based in Miami, he joined the firm in 2021. Before Thoma Bravo, Cook worked at Brentwood Capital Advisors as a Director, helping lead the firm’s technology M&A and capital raising advisory practice. Prior to that, he worked at Accel in Palo Alto helping lead growth equity investments across the technology industry, and at Thoma Bravo in San Francisco helping lead investments in enterprise software companies. He began his career at Greenhill in the M&A and restructuring group in New York. Cook graduated from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia, where he earned a BS in Commerce.

Eliza Young is Vice President, Communications and Marketing at Thoma Bravo. She joined the firm in 2022 to focus on marketing, internal communications, and Thoma Bravo's diversity and inclusion strategy. Eliza has more than a decade of demonstrated success across various sectors, including financial services, tech and international NGOs. Most recently, she was an Internal Communications Manager at Meta. Before that, Eliza held internal and corporate communications roles at Macquarie Investment Management, Allianz Global Investors and JPMorgan Chase. Previously, she served as a writer, editor and researcher for several international human rights and humanitarian aid organizations. Eliza earned an MA in International Relations from King's College London and a BA in European History from Barnard College at Columbia University.

Gene Austin is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. He has over 30 years of experience leading private and public software companies, including 19 years as CEO. Most recently, Gene was the CEO of Quorum Software, where he led the company through a significant transformation from a provider of accounting and operational software in North America to a global provider of software and services throughout the energy value chain. During his four years, the company made six acquisitions and a merger to produce the largest software company dedicated to the oil and gas energy market. Before Quorum, he was CEO at Bazaarvoice, the leading provider of user-generated content for retailers and brands. Bazaarvoice was in transition, and Gene led the company to profitability and growth and on to a successful sale in 2018. Before Bazaarvoice, he led venture-backed Convio, a leading provider of fundraising and marketing solutions for nonprofits, through significant growth and expansion culminating in a 2010 IPO and a 2012 sale to Blackbaud. Gene holds an MBA from Washington University, where he received the 2019 Olin Business School Distinguished Alumni Award, and he has a BS degree in Engineering Management from Southern Methodist University.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Marcel Bernard is a Senior Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. He has more than 40 years of business operating experience, primarily with companies in the technology industry. Most recently, he was Corporate Vice President, Operations of Geac Computer Corporation, a performance management software company, where he was responsible for the management and overall performance of several business units located in North America, Europe and the United Kingdom, representing $250 million in revenues. Previously, Marcel was Senior Vice President, Ontario Division, of St. Lawrence Cement, where he was responsible for the management of all Ontario business units, representing over $400 million in revenues. Marcel was also President and CEO of SaskTel, Saskatchewan’s largest phone company with $600 million in revenues and over 4,200 employees. He also held various positions with Motorola Corporation, most notably as President of Motorola Canada. He has been on the board of directors, in some cases serving as Chairman, of many of Thoma Bravo’s Software portfolio companies.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Mark Bishof is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. He brings over 40 years of experience leading private and public software companies, including 15 years as CEO. Most recently, Mark served as Strategic Advisor and Chief Business Officer of Qualtrics following its acquisition of Clarabridge. As CEO of Clarabridge, he was responsible for pivoting a customer-experience text analytics business into a leader in conversational AI that sold to Qualtrics for $1.2 billion. He led the acquisition and successful integration of all aspects of Clarabridge into Qualtrics, which today is the company's Discover AI growth engine for the global CX market. Mark also served as CEO of Flexera Software from 2008 to 2015. There, he was responsible for taking a $180 million divisional carve out from Macrovision and creating a new company, Flexera Software, in the software license management space that today serves over 50,000 customers worldwide. Before Flexera, he was EVP of Sales & Services at Macrovision, responsible for all go-to-market and delivery of all Macrovision products and services. Mark has held various Board positions with organizations such as Nature Conservancy, Pace Harman, and Bucknell University, and several Thoma Bravo portfolio companies, including Eptura, Infogix, Mercell, and NextGen Healthcare. Earlier in his career, he held management and sales leadership roles at IBM, Crossworlds Software, Deloitte Consulting, and Booz, Allen & Hamilton, and he spent five years with the U.S. Navy. Mark holds a BS in Computer and Information Systems from the University of Maryland.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Pete Boyes is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. Pete has more than 20 years of experience in driving operational excellence and value creation at companies such as Zego (acquired by Global Payments), Soasta (acquired by Akamai Technologies), and ID Analytics (acquired by Symantec/LifeLock). Before his CFO and GM roles, he was a technology Investment Banker completing numerous M&A and Corporate Finance transactions across the technology landscape. Most recently, as the former CFO and GM of Zego (a Vista Equity-backed investment), Pete was instrumental in helping drive strategy and revenue growth both organically and through acquisitions, leading to a successful exit to Global Payments. He assumed the GM role after the acquisition and led the integration efforts of Zego into the Integrated Software division at Global Payments. Pete has BA and MBA degrees from the University of Southern California.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Tom Clark is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. He has more than 20 years of experience as a financial and operating executive across a variety of industries. Tom is recognized consistently by all levels of the organization as a goal-oriented leader with a proven ability to influence corporate results by instilling accountability and providing strategic, operational and financial insight. Before becoming an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo, he was CFO of IDaptive, LLC (a Thoma Bravo portfolio company), Ayla Networks Inc., Openwave Messaging, Inc. and CollabNet, Inc. Additionally, Tom was an Operating Director for Marlin Equity Partners, where he provided financial diligence expertise for enterprise software acquisitions and provided financial and operational guidance to Marlin owned companies. Tom has extensive experience with buy-side, sell-side, carve-outs, and distressed situations. He is a Certified Public Accountant in the State of California and earned his BS degree from Saint Mary's College of California.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Steve Cochran is a Technology Partner at Thoma Bravo. He has more than 30 years of experience leading technology transformation and operational excellence at companies such as Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX), OpenText/GXS, Inovis, Adaptec, Real3D, Lockheed Martin and General Electric. Steve most recently was the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) at GHX, a former Thoma Bravo portfolio company subsequently sold to Temasek. During his tenure at GHX, he created the strategy, architected, led development and migrated the company's core asset and customers to the AWS public cloud profoundly transforming the company. At OpenText/GXS, Steve was the VP of Product Management leading the transformation of their global B2B exchange for retail and automotive markets. As CTO at Inovis, he led the transformation of their B2B exchange. Steve also led the development of the initial generations of 3D graphic controllers at Real3D and led development of products for the RAID storage industry as a division vice president at Adaptec. Steve started his career with GE/Lockheed Martin designing submarine and shipboard systems. Steve has an MBA from Crummer Graduate School of Business at Rollins College and a BS degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Kentucky.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Cindy Crane is an Operating Advisor for Thoma Bravo, where she provides financial management, reporting and operations support to the firm's portfolio companies. She has 25 years of finance experience focused on optimizing performance, profitability and operational effectiveness in private and public technology companies. She most recently served as the business unit controller for Security Products at Dell for three years. For the prior eight years, Cindy was the vice president of FP&A for SonicWALL, a network security company. SonicWALL was a Thoma Bravo portfolio company from 2010-2012 and subsequently sold to Dell. Cindy earned her MBA from Santa Clara University and BA degree in Quantitative Economics and Decision Sciences from UC San Diego.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Tom Davis is a Technology Partner with Thoma Bravo. He brings more than 25 years of experience in technology and enterprise software. During his career, he has served in a variety of positions including quality assurance, software development, engineering management, product management, architecture, CTO and CEO. Notably he orchestrated several engineering turn-arounds and managed both large strategic acquisitions as well as small tech tuck-ins, with a focus on creating enterprise value growth. Tom served as CTO of Ivanti, CEO of mobile startup Celio, Chief Platform Architect at Avocent, EVP of Research and Development at LANDESK, and CTO of the software and services division at Intel. Tom has a BS degree in Electrical Engineering from Brigham Young University and continued his education at Westminster College and Cal Berkley. He served in the United States Air Force and graduated with honors in the top 10% of his class.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Gary Fry brings more than 20 years of experience in enterprise software and go-to-market leadership. He is a three-time software CEO with extensive European market knowledge and expertise helping companies transition to a subscription-based business model. Most recently, Gary served as CEO of iText, where he spearheaded company growth to more than double the size of the company, pivoted to a fully recurring business model, and successfully sold the business to Thoma Bravo. Previously, he served as Interim CEO of Aleyant and CEO of Global Graphics. Earlier in his career, he held sales leadership roles at Adobe, Oracle and IBM. Gary has an MBA from the University of Reading.

* Senior Operating Partners, Operating Partners and Operating Advisors are independent contractors that are advisors to Thoma Bravo and portfolio companies of Thoma Bravo, and are neither employees nor affiliates of Thoma Bravo entities.

Kiely George is an Operating Advisor for Thoma Bravo, where she provides financial management, reporting, and operations support to the firm's portfolio companies. She has 15 years of finance experience focused on optimizing performance, profitability, and operational effectiveness in private companies. Kiely most recently served as VP of Financial Operations at Elemica. While at Elemica, she was a key member of the M&A team, providing financial due diligence and successfully integrating four acquisitions over three years. Kiely earned her MBA from St. Joseph's University and BA degree in Finance from the University of Pittsburgh.

Vito Giuliani is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. He has a wide range of experience with both INC and Fortune 250 companies.

Vito’s negotiation creativity and operational experiences contributed to past successes in data center consolidation, headquarters office complex construction, multi-national procurement organizations, delivering annual cost reductions, and consistently meeting deadlines and exceeding budget targets. Vito most recently served as Chief Procurement Officer at ADP, where he managed the worldwide Purchasing, Real Estate and Facilities Organizations. Vito also served as a Trustee of the ADP Foundation and sat on the Supplier Diversity Council, the ADP Social Responsibility Council, and Risk Committee. Before ADP, he held similar positions at GE Capital Corporation and PaineWebber, Inc.

Vito holds a BS degree in Accounting from Iona College and has attended Wharton’s School of Business for executive education.

Charles Goodman is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. Charles has more than 30 years of experience building profitable businesses. Currently, he is interim CEO at Coupa Software, which was acquired by Thoma Bravo in 2023. Previously he served as interim CEO of Anaplan, which was acquired by Thoma Bravo in 2022. Before Anaplan, he was CEO of PowerPlan, a Thoma Bravo portfolio company that sold to Roper Technologies in 2018. Prior to joining PowerPlan in 2015, Charles was CEO of P2 Energy Solutions. As CEO, he executed multiple market strategies and led three acquisitions to expand the solution portfolio from the back office into operations, while steadily growing P2’s presence across the globe. At Ventyx, he served as COO and was instrumental in developing new global markets across six continents. In addition to helping companies expand, Charles has a passion for transforming organizations by focusing on employee culture and the customer experience. During his tenure at Atmos Energy, where he was EVP, Corporate Operations, he experienced first-hand how these factors influenced the company’s success. Charles graduated from Texas Tech University with a BS degree in Engineering.

James (Jim) Hagan is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. Jim brings more than 20 years of experience in helping public and private equity-backed software companies grow and scale. Most recently, he spent four years as CFO at MedeAnalytics, a Thoma Bravo portfolio company. Previously, Jim held various management roles, including COO, CFO and interim-CEO at Forcepoint, a global cybersecurity company where he oversaw revenue growth from $365 million to $580 million. Before Forcepoint, he served in various finance roles at Websense and Fair Isaac (FICO), and he worked in both the Industrial and Global Financial Sponsors groups at Lehman Brothers. John Kim is an Operating Advisor at Thoma Bravo, where he provides financial planning, analysis and reporting support to the portfolio companies and financial due diligence guidance to the companies’ board of directors. He is a seasoned finance and treasury professional, with more than 25 years of experience in various financial and engineering leadership capacities. John spent the first six years of his career as an engineer at Honeywell, where he transitioned into finance. He worked at global technology companies such as Autodesk, UTStarcom, Keynote Systems and Embarcadero Technologies in a finance capacity and most recently as vice president of finance and treasurer for Digital Insight Corporation, which was acquired from Intuit and subsequently sold to NCR by Thoma Bravo. John has an MBA degree from the University of Southern California and BS and MS degrees in Mechanical Engineering from the University of California, Los Angeles.

Jay Larson is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. Jay has an impressive track record as a successful CEO, transformation driver, and value-creating leader of world-class enterprise organizations. He served as CEO at Optimizely, a venture-backed software company that he and his team grew and ultimately sold to a PE-owned software company. Before Optimizely, Jay was the CEO at Birst Software, another venture-backed firm that was sold to a large application software company. Jay also has an outstanding record as a leader of sales organizations. At Mercury Interactive, he spent seven years building the go-to-market team that drove Mercury’s revenue from $300 million to over $1 billion. During his five-year tenure at SuccessFactors, he built a global sales team that drove revenue from $80 million to over $360 million when SuccessFactors was acquired by SAP. Jay also held sales leadership positions at Oracle, Siebel Systems, and Jive Software. He is passionate about helping companies sell more and sell more efficiently. Jay has a BA degree in Economics from Harvard University and an MBA from the Anderson School of Management at UCLA.

James (Jim) K. Lines is a Senior Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. Jim is Chief Executive Officer of Lines Consulting Group and has provided advisory services to Thoma Bravo and its predecessor firms for more than 10 years. He previously was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of United Surgical Partners International, Inc., a private equity sponsored operator of surgery centers and hospitals, and Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of ITI Marketing Services, a tele-services firm backed by GTCR. Jim’s background also includes 12 years in various financial management capacities at affiliates of AMR Corporation (American Airlines), during which he served as Director-Corporate Finance, Managing Director-Corporate Development, and Chief Financial Officer of The SABRE Group, a global electronic travel distributor with $1.5 billion in revenue. Jim has served as a director and/or acting CFO of a number of Thoma Bravo portfolio companies.

Mike Lipps is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. Mike has over 30 years of experience in both public company and private equity software investments, having held numerous executive leadership and board positions in world-class technology companies for investors, including Thoma Bravo, Hg Capital, TA Associates, K1 Capital, and Genstar Capital. He has an established track record of building and leading multiple rule of 50+ PE-backed companies that have generated a combined $5B+ in investor value. He specializes in strategically accretive M&A, having completed over 25 successful transactions in his career, in addition to human capital /workforce transformation and business process management. Most recently, Mike was CEO of Intelerad Medical Systems. During his tenure, he tripled company revenue and EBITDA, acquiring and integrating seven businesses to build the leading global radiology practice imaging platform. Before Intelerad, he led the rapid growth and market success of insightsoftware. As CEO, he grew revenues 7x and EBITDA 10x while acquiring 15 businesses and building a global leader in financial budgeting and reporting software. Previously, Mike was the Division CEO at LexisNexis, responsible for a portfolio of award-winning software products serving global law firms and corporations. There, he led the creation and management of the LexisNexis Technology Center, which was named North Carolina Technology Workplace of the Year in 2012 by the North Carolina Technology Association. The North Carolina Triangle Business Journal awarded Mike CIO of the Year in 2014. Mike spent the first 14 years of his career at Intuit Inc., where he led several software businesses, including QuickBooks, the #1 rated US small business financial software application. He has a background in software product management, marketing, and operations.

Joel Martins is an Operating Advisor at Thoma Bravo. He has more than 20 years of experience driving innovation, growth and operational excellence in software companies. Joel led global enterprise teams for 14 years at Symantec. At Symantec, he led teams in the enterprise data protection suite, growing the NetBackup product line to over $1B. Joel also served as CTO at MicroEdge, which was sold to publicly traded Blackbuad (Nasdaq: BLKB in 2014). Before joining Thoma Bravo, Joel served as CTO at Social Solutions, completing a transaction from Vista Equity Partners to Apax Partners. During his time at Social Solutions, Joel oversaw the creation and launch of a new product line and dramatic growth. He also recruited the Ballmer Group, which included a $59M investment in Social Solutions from former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer, who joined the company's Board of Directors. Joel graduated from the University of Minnesota with a BS degree in Computer Science and attended Luther Seminary in St. Paul post-graduate.

G. William (Bill) McKinzie is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. Bill is the former President & CEO of Manatron Inc., which was a Thoma Bravo portfolio company during his tenure in that position and subsequently was sold to Thomson Reuters (NYSE: TRI), a global information services company. He joined Manatron Inc. in 2002 and focused on improvements in product management, including marketing, support, pricing and strategy, which played an important role in Manatron becoming a leading provider of integrated, enterprise-level property tax solutions for state and local governments. Prior to joining Manatron, Bill was Vice President of Information Services for Kellogg Company's International operations, based in Battle Creek, Michigan, and, before that, Vice President and Chief Information Officer of Kellogg's European operations based in the United Kingdom and its Latin American operations based in Mexico. Bill has a MBA degree in Finance from Loyola University of Chicago and a BS degree in Computer Science and Mathematics from Bowling Green State University.

Richard Northing is an Operating Advisor at Thoma Bravo. He has more than 21 years of experience in the technology industry, with a focus on the delivery of software and services to Fortune 1000 companies. Previously he served as SVP of Products & Services for Flexera Software, where he had worldwide responsibility for all product development, professional services delivery, and technical account management. He previously led Global Services at Macrovision. Before joining Macrovision, he spent eight years at Intraware where he established a world-class customer engagement model in a SaaS environment while serving as VP of Technology Operations and Chief Operating Officer. Richard spent the first 10 years of his career in various engineering, engineering management, and consulting positions at EDS and Accenture. Richard has a Bachelor of Sciences (First Class, with honors) degree from the University of Liverpool and a PhD from the University of Oxford in the UK.

Steve Pace is an Operating Advisor for Thoma Bravo. He has more than four decades of technology experience, starting his career as a digital logic engineer with IBM and, most recently, as the Chief Revenue Officer for Dynatrace. Steve was hired by Dynatrace soon after Thoma Bravo acquired the company in 2016. There, he built and grew the sales organization through the company's IPO in 2019 and retired from Dynatrace in the Fall of 2023. Steve contributed to the company's growth of nearly 500% during his tenure, marking Dynatrace as a highly desirable "Rule of 50" company with a global presence in over 50 countries. Earlier in his career, he held executive management positions with Raytheon, Forcepoint, Netscout, GeoTrust (acquired by VeriSign), NaviSite, and Seagate Software (acquired by Veritas). Steve graduated with Honors with a BSEE in Electrical Engineering from Pennsylvania State University. For nearly two decades, he has served on the Advisory Board at the College of Information Sciences and Technology at Penn State. Steve also serves as an Advisor to the Bravo Family Foundation for Entrepreneurship.

Anthony Palladino is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. He has more than 20 years of experience as a financial and operating executive. Anthony’s experience has centered around taking small entrepreneurial companies and helping them establish operational and financial protocols to achieve rapid growth. He has worked for multiple companies, including Bentley Systems (CAD Software) and HR Logic (PEO), and he spent the majority of his career at Elemica (a former Thoma Bravo portfolio company) in various executive positions, including CFO. Don Siegel is an Operating Advisor for Thoma Bravo, where he provides financial management, operations and reporting guidance to the firm's portfolio companies. Based in Chicago, he joined the firm in 2015 and most recently served as the Vice President of Portfolio Analysis. Don joined Thoma Bravo from City Capital Advisors, where he was an Investment Banking Analyst, working on mergers, acquisitions and valuation analysis. Before City Capital, he was a Transactions and Restructuring Associate at KPMG, performing financial due diligence and quality of earnings analysis for both Private Equity and Strategic buyers. Paul Statham is an Operating Advisor at Thoma Bravo. Paul has over 30 years’ experience of founding and operating successful technology businesses, with a focus on rapid growth through innovation. Most recently he was CEO of Condeco, a global leader in workspace scheduling, that was acquired by Thoma Bravo in 2021. At Condeco, Paul’s visionary views on the world of work and the management of the workplace helped shape the technology within the sector. As CEO, he oversaw the opening of nine offices around the world and was instrumental in developing new global markets across four continents, led three acquisitions to expand the solution portfolio, and grew revenues from zero to $100m. Previously Paul co-founded RNM Systems, a consultancy company delivering outsourced software development to some of the world’s leading corporations. Paul also co-founded FX Player, an online fantasy trading game which was sold in 2005 to IFX Markets in 2005. Paul spent the first 16 years of his life in the electronic security industry, where he was co-founder of Masco Security, one of the UK leading providers. He is also a Trustee of Charlton Athletic Community Trust, a charity dedicated to empowering young individuals to improve their lives and their environment.

Adam Thier is an Operating Advisor at Thoma Bravo. He is a senior software engineering executive with an exceptional track record at multiple startups and SaaS leaders, as well as at one of the world's largest software companies. Adam attributes his success to his passion for great design and an understanding of human/computer interaction. He spent several years as the SAP executive sponsor of the Hasso Plattner D.School at Stanford University, where he coached teams of graduate students on design-thinking projects.

Most recently, Adam was Head of Applications at Vianai, which focuses on building a platform that removes the technical and expertise barriers so regular business users can understand and apply the advantages of AI/ML in their operations. Before Vianai, he was Chief Technology Officer at Avetta. While there, he was awarded the CXO of the Year award from Utah Business Magazine for his work in helping change how millions of tradespeople interact with technology and reduced their accident and fatality rates by over 75%. Before Avetta, he was EVP of Engineering for the SaaS business line at Keynote Systems, which was acquired by Dynatrace, a Thoma Bravo company. Prior to that, Adam spent seven years in executive leadership positions at SAP, including SVP of Engineering and Chief Architect, where he worked directly with the company's global customers on a variety of technology programs. Before SAP, he was SVP Application Development at Hyperion. Adam has a BA degree in Communication Arts from Marist College.

David Weiss is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. David is a seasoned executive with over 25 years in the software business. From 2002 until 2011, he served as President and CEO of Numara Software, Inc. (formerly Blue Ocean Software), where he led the company to significant growth through product and market expansion. Prior to Numara, David served as vice president of worldwide marketing for Citrix Systems, Inc. during its rapid expansion from a small, private company to a global leader in remote access software solutions. He also was part of the founding team of a VC-funded software company in the late 1990s, and he spent seven years at Lotus and five years at IBM in various sales, marketing and technical positions. Dave has BS degrees in Computer Science and Economics from Duke University.

Kristin Nimsger Weston is an Operating Partner at Thoma Bravo. She has more than 20 years of experience driving outsized growth in software and technology companies. Kristin was President of Kroll Ontrack, where she ran the legal tech business from start-up to more than $200M in seven years. Kroll Ontrack operated in 23 countries with 1500+ employees when it was sold to Providence Equity Partners in 2010 for over $1.1B. She then was the General Manager of the litigation software division of Thomson Reuters. Kristin then served as CEO of two Vista Equity Partners portfolio companies: MicroEdge, which was sold to publicly traded Blackbaud (Nasdaq: BLKB) for more than 7x MOIC in 2014, and Social Solutions Global which was sold to Apax Partners in 2021 for 5x MOIC. During her time with Social Solutions, Kristin led the negotiation of the partnership and investment from Ballmer Group, which included a $59M investment from former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer, who joined the company's Board of Directors. Before joining Thoma Bravo, she served as a Senior Advisor, Private Equity to Vista Equity Partners. Kristin has a BA from the University of Minnesota, a Juris Doctorate from William Mitchell College of Law, and a Certificate in Management and Leadership from MIT Sloan School of Management.
